sen.j: 野口 兼資（のぐち かねすけ、1879年（明治12年）11月7日 - 1953年（昭和28年）10月4日）は、シテ方宝生流能楽師。
sen.e: Kanesuke NOGUCHI (November 7, 1879 - October 4, 1953) was a Noh actor of the Hosho school of lead actors (shite-kata).
Kanesuke NOGUCHI (November 7, 1879 - October 4, 1953) was a Noh actor of the Hosho school of shite-kata (lead actors).
Kanesuke NOGUCHI (November 7, 1879 - October 4, 1953) was a Noh actor of the Hosho school of shite-kata (lead actors).

sen.j: 本名、野口政吉（のぐち まさきち）。
sen.e: His real name was Masakichi NOGUCHI.
His real name was Masakichi NOGUCHI.
His real name was Masakichi NOGUCHI.

sen.j: 愛知県名古屋市に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Nagoya City, Aichi Prefecture.
He was born in Nagoya City, Aichi Prefecture.
He was born in Nagoya City, Aichi Prefecture.
He was the best disciple of Kuro Tomoharu HOSHO the 16th.
He was the best disciple of Kuro Tomoharu HOSHO, the 16th head of the school.
sen.cmt: the 16th→, the 16th head of the schoolとしました。
sen.e: He was the best disciple of Kuro Tomoharu HOSHO, the 16th head of the school.

sen.j: 幽玄な芸風で、松本長と並び称された。
sen.e: He was admired for the subtle and profound style of his performance along with Nagashi MATSUMOTO.
He was admired for the subtle and profound style of his performance along with Nagashi MATSUMOTO.
He was admired for the subtle and profound style of his performance along with Nagashi MATSUMOTO.
He was a member of the Japan Art Academy.
He was a member of the Japan Art Academy.
He was a member of the Japan Art Academy.
